title: Paramedic Interview
Interview Descriptions: Fair, good evaluation of knowledge and values. Done in 2 parts - a situational judgement test and an online MMI and practical evaluation followed by contacting references and then sending out offers.
Interview Questions: What does equity, diversity and inclusion mean to you?

title: Technical Support Interview
Interview Descriptions: Was waiting for the phone call from HR but never called even after confirming the date and time for this phone call. So disrespectful. Not complaining have to go in daily there isn't any hybrid so worked out.
Interview Questions: HR never called me during the time they scheduled.

title: Aviation Safety Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ornge (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
My first interview was conducted by an HR coordinator. Days later, my second interview included the Manager, Aviation Safety; the Director, Aviation Safety; and the HR coordinator.  Each interview lasted approximately one hour. 
The hiring panel was very professional and respectful.
The hiring process included a background check and three references.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe my understanding of flight data analysis (FDA) and trend monitoring.

title: Analyst Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was well organized , it was first a phone conversation then a panel interview with a presentation.  The phone conversation was basically to get to know if the candidate will be a good fit to move to the next stage. That took about two weeks then was moved to the next stage for the panel interview. The next stage entailed a presentation which was timed for 15 mins and then the rest of the time was used for the interview questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and highlight the benefits to Ornge

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Ornge (Mississauga, ON) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a Panel style interview with four people. Due to covid, it was a virtual interview.  i found the interview fair and the panel members were easy to speak with. We had an open and professional discussion.

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Ornge
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone call followed by in-person interview. It was a very fair and welcoming panel of interviewers for the hour long interview. I went in prepared and studied the company along with the role and it was helpful
Interview Questions: Related to working shift-work including holidays, etc. throughout the year

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ornge (Mississauga, ON) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Standard behavioural questions with some technical questions asked. Group interview, 2 HR and 1 Other; Nice people, but they don't get back to you if your not successful. Less than an hour long (about 35 minutes). Sitting in a Boardroom, all 3 interviewees take turns asking questions. Fairly standard process.
Interview Questions:
walk through your resume
what do you know about Ornge
what is your ideal boss like

title: Executive Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ornge (Mississauga, ON) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Average interview process but hiring process was unlike any other I've experienced. Three to four HR staff involved when most companies would use one or two at the most. HR reference checks are outsourced to another company with barely english speaking reps so all my reference providers were highly irritated with the process. An initial job offer was made that was lower than my last position, (despite Ornge being given salary info). When I asked for further consideration to be made regarding the base salary the offer was rescinded via email without any discussion whatsoever. I have probably dodged an employment bullet if this is typical of management behaviour.
Interview Questions: How well do you handle job stress?

title: Full-time Employee Interview
Interview Descriptions: Initial telephone interview.  Followed by in-person interview, which began nearly 1/2 hour late.  Panel of two managers and HR.  Questions were easy, but it was obvious that one of the interviewers was trying to stump me as he kept changing the questions after I had answered.  Initially not informed there would be a test following panel interview, but it wasn't difficult, just time-consuming.  I felt they already had a candidate in mind, and just went through this interview as a formality.

title: Procurement Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ornge (Mississauga, ON) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lots of behavioural questions, specific experience requirements, talk about yourself, why you want the job, past experience. The overall experience was fairly easy going. It was more like a conversation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Compliance Specialist Interview
Interview Descriptions: Interview with executive who you will be working under.

title: Media Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ornge (Mississauga, ON) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview was fine - standard questions. At the in-person interview, I was kept waiting for over 20 minutes. The HR Manager looked at me and said "Oh, we don't wear suits here, you can take your jacket and tie off" I declined - what was I supposed to do, put my tie in my pocket? Interview was standard HR type questions that don't really reveal anything. The job description was vastly inflated - they wanted someone to manage press clippings, but wrote the description in a way that made the job seem more important.
Interview Questions: Usual HR type of questions that don't really mean anything i.e. 'How do you handle conflict?"
